content: @Laryn so the issue you're stuck on is the apply and insert?
@Phil Ward Yes, when you try to apply the exposed filename filter in the WYSIWYG editor's implementation of the image library, everything explodes.
(It seems to work fine in a field level implementation, the issue is just with WYSIWYG)
Maybe it's not possible, but what about filtering using ajax and removing the apply button? Personally, I like this type of UX better than typing something and hitting apply.
I would say to show all images (with pager) by default, then reduce the images shown based on the input field using ajax. "filter out" what we don't need.

Yes, I think showing all and filtering based on input would be great. I'm not necessarily opposed to the ajax auto-submit, but it can get a little dicey with a text input field, and I'm not sure about accessibility.
